content.description: POPULATION IN GERMANY, 1871 TO 1910Total Population Percent Rural Percent Urban 1871 41,059,000 63.9 36.1 1880 45,234,000 58.6 41.4 1890 49,428,000 57.5 42.5 1900 56,367,000 45.6 54.4 1910 64,926,000 40.0 60.0 Source: Adapted from Koppel S. Pinson, Modern Germany, Macmillan, New York, 1966, p. 221.
content.question: The changes in the percentage of urban and rural populations shown in the table are best explained by which of the following?

choices.label: The unification of Germany by Prussia
The abolition of serfdom in Eastern Europe
The spread of industrial production methods to Germany
The destruction caused by the Revolutions of 1848

content.answer: The spread of industrial production methods to Germany

topic.text: 6.10: Causation in the Age of Industrialization

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
